title: What makes a poetry expressive? - Quora

response.answer_text: I agree with the other answers, write what the heart wants, what you feel, how you feel. Word pictures are always cool. Comparing things to other things to describe the thing also cool. As an example: Lobster as red as a tomato - comparing thing to other thing to illustrate thingShining in the sun like a sparkling ruby - comparing thing to describe thing You have lots of creative freedom, don’t be afraid to write down silly poems if that’s what you’re in the mood for, you’ll improve over time as we all do when we repeat things a lot. It is fun.

Hi.. Poetry itself is expressive we don't need to make it expressive. Generally we write poem to express ourselves. We don't write in such a way that people should feel it is expressive. So just take pen and paper and jot down whatever you feels. When you'll write what u wanted to express it'll automatically become expressive Thanks for reading.. Keep writing poems
Staying true to what you feel, staying true to what you go through, and staying true to what you write is what makes the poetry expressive.
When you write what you feel and not simply write what is considered a poem
